text: hi guys you are not gonna believe what
I'm making today it's so fun it's fried
macaroni and cheese bites so you have to
start off by making your macaroni and
cheese this is one box of elbow macaroni
in salted boiling water cook that until
it's all dente according to the package
directions it's about six minutes though
give that a stir and then start working
on your sauce for the sauce I have four
tablespoons of melted unsalted butter to
that add six tablespoons of all-purpose
flour making a roux stir it when I coat
all the flour with butter and cook it
until it has sort of a slightly nutty
aroma thirty seconds one minute this is
a very simple bechamel for this macaroni
and cheese but this one has just a
little bit of mustard powder to amp up
the flavor three-quarters of a teaspoon
of dry mustard whisk in four cups of
milk start off slowly so you can see
that I'm adding this gradually because
as you add a little bit of milk it lumps
up a bit and you want to make sure that
this mixture is nice and smooth now that
all the milk has been added you want to
whisk it just a bit more and then bring
it to a simmer and it has to cook until
it thickens slightly and that could take
about eight to ten minutes check the
pasta make sure it's not overcooking and
they are ready right away and now you
just need to wait for your bechamel
it's nice thick and smooth and it's
simmered for about eight minutes add
your cheese this is 4 and 3/4 cups of
grated cheddar cheese one more
tablespoon of butter so it's 5
tablespoons total stir until cheese
melts and then enter my pasta in it
might have gotten slightly lumpy just
sitting in the sink but that's okay
because it will loosen right up in the
mixture is a 9 by 13 inch baking dish I
just lined the bottom with a piece of
parchment and then sprayed or brushed
with oil pour in your mac and cheese and
then just get it into the refrigerator
and let it chill that'll take a couple
hours okay this is refrigerated for 8
hours and is nice and solid you should
be able to get it out of the pan to cut
it into squares then you can just turn
out onto your cutting board today
sometimes you just have to loosen it a
little bit with a knife or a spatula to
get a little bit of air in there and it
just pops right out peel off the
parchment and then cut it into whatever
size you want I'm gonna do like one-inch
squares and we'll do a couple rows all
righty
now you can bread them I have four eggs
here whisk your four eggs and here are
some panko bread crumbs with a little
bit of cayenne pepper in there you just
whisk that together you want to coat
each cube in egg first
once they're coated with egg then you
want to coat them with your panko
mixture and then fry them in a little
bit of oil golden brown give it a turn
when they're golden brown and heated
through they are done drain them on some
paper towel just a little bit and then
get another batch started because these
guys are gonna disappear before you can
say mac and cheese fights enjoy
you
